text: <a href="../2-Samuel-15-1/" title="2 Samuel 15:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And it came to pass after this, that Absalom prepared him chariots and horses, and fifty men to run before him.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-2/" title="2 Samuel 15:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And Absalom rose up early, and stood beside the way of the gate: and it was *so*, that when any man that had a controversy came to the king for judgment, then Absalom called unto him, and said, Of what city *art* thou? And he said, Thy servant *is* of one of the tribes of Israel.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-3/" title="2 Samuel 15:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And Absalom said unto him, See, thy matters *are* good and right; but *there is* no man *deputed* of the king to hear thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-4/" title="2 Samuel 15:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man which hath any suit or cause might come unto me, and I would do him justice!

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-5/" title="2 Samuel 15:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And it was *so*, that when any man came nigh *to him* to do him obeisance, he put forth his hand, and took him, and kissed him.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-6/" title="2 Samuel 15:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And on this manner did Absalom to all Israel that came to the king for judgment: so Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-7/" title="2 Samuel 15:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And it came to pass after forty years, that Absalom said unto the king, I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto the LORD, in Hebron.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-8/" title="2 Samuel 15:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Syria, saying, If the LORD shall bring me again indeed to Jerusalem, then I will serve the LORD.
<a href="../2-Samuel-15-9/" title="2 Samuel 15:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And the king said unto him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to Hebron.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-10/" title="2 Samuel 15:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, As soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet, then ye shall say, Absalom reigneth in Hebron.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-11/" title="2 Samuel 15:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And with Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, *that were* called; and they went in their simplicity, and they knew not any thing.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-12/" title="2 Samuel 15:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David's counsellor, from his city, *even* from Giloh, while he offered sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-13/" title="2 Samuel 15:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And there came a messenger to David, saying, The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-14/" title="2 Samuel 15:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And David said unto all his servants that *were* with him at Jerusalem, Arise, and let us flee; for we shall not *else* escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he overtake us suddenly, and bring evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-15/" title="2 Samuel 15:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And the king's servants said unto the king, Behold, thy servants *are ready to do* whatsoever my lord the king shall appoint.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-16/" title="2 Samuel 15:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And the king went forth, and all his household after him. And the king left ten women, *which were* concubines, to keep the house.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-17/" title="2 Samuel 15:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And the king went forth, and all the people after him, and tarried in a place that was far off.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-18/" title="2 Samuel 15:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And all his servants passed on beside him; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men which came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-19/" title="2 Samuel 15:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Then said the king to Ittai the Gittite, Wherefore goest thou also with us? return to thy place, and abide with the king: for thou *art* a stranger, and also an exile.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-20/" title="2 Samuel 15:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Whereas thou camest *but* yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us? seeing I go whither I may, return thou, and take back thy brethren: mercy and truth *be* with thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-21/" title="2 Samuel 15:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And Ittai answered the king, and said, *As* the LORD liveth, and *as* my lord the king liveth, surely in what place my lord the king shall be, whether in death or life, even there also will thy servant be.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-22/" title="2 Samuel 15:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 And David said to Ittai, Go and pass over. And Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all his men, and all the little ones that *were* with him.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-23/" title="2 Samuel 15:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 And all the country wept with a loud voice, and all the people passed over: the king also himself passed over the brook Kidron, and all the people passed over, toward the way of the wilderness.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-24/" title="2 Samuel 15:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And lo Zadok also, and all the Levites *were* with him, bearing the ark of the covenant of God: and they set down the ark of God; and Abiathar went up, until all the people had done passing out of the city.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-25/" title="2 Samuel 15:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 And the king said unto Zadok, Carry back the ark of God into the city: if I shall find favour in the eyes of the LORD, he will bring me again, and shew me *both* it, and his habitation:

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-26/" title="2 Samuel 15:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 But if he thus say, I have no delight in thee; behold, *here am* I, let him do to me as seemeth good unto him.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-27/" title="2 Samuel 15:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 The king said also unto Zadok the priest, *Art not* thou a seer? return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you, Ahimaaz thy son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-28/" title="2 Samuel 15:28 KJV verse detail"><span id="30" class="versehover">28 See, I will tarry in the plain of the wilderness, until there come word from you to certify me.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-29/" title="2 Samuel 15:29 KJV verse detail"><span id="31" class="versehover">29 Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem: and they tarried there.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-30/" title="2 Samuel 15:30 KJV verse detail"><span id="32" class="versehover">30 And David went up by the ascent of *mount* Olivet, and wept as he went up, and had his head covered, and he went barefoot: and all the people that *was* with him covered every man his head, and they went up, weeping as they went up.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-31/" title="2 Samuel 15:31 KJV verse detail"><span id="33" class="versehover">31 And *one* told David, saying, Ahithophel *is* among the conspirators with Absalom. And David said, O LORD, I pray thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-32/" title="2 Samuel 15:32 KJV verse detail"><span id="34" class="versehover">32 And it came to pass, that *when* David was come to the top *of the mount*, where he worshipped God, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent, and earth upon his head:
<a href="../2-Samuel-15-33/" title="2 Samuel 15:33 KJV verse detail"><span id="35" class="versehover">33 Unto whom David said, If thou passest on with me, then thou shalt be a burden unto me:

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-34/" title="2 Samuel 15:34 KJV verse detail"><span id="36" class="versehover">34 But if thou return to the city, and say unto Absalom, I will be thy servant, O king; *as* I *have been* thy father's servant hitherto, so *will* I now also *be* thy servant: then mayest thou for me defeat the counsel of Ahithophel.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-35/" title="2 Samuel 15:35 KJV verse detail"><span id="37" class="versehover">35 And *hast thou* not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, *that* what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the king's house, thou shalt tell *it* to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.

<a href="../2-Samuel-15-36/" title="2 Samuel 15:36 KJV verse detail"><span id="38" class="versehover">36 Behold, *they have* there with them their two sons, Ahimaaz Zadok's *son*, and Jonathan Abiathar's *son*; and by them ye shall send unto me every thing that ye can hear.
<a href="../2-Samuel-15-37/" title="2 Samuel 15:37 KJV verse detail"><span id="39" class="versehover">37 So Hushai David's friend came into the city, and Absalom came into Jerusalem.
